title: Unusable Loot...Fix (?)
body:
I, and a few other people in the discussion boards, have been having an issue where for the past 2 - 3 days, based on my experience and the other posters experience, we have been either almost or completely unable to use any loot in the Hextech crafting system.

Didn't really care much when it started happening immediately, because I was fortunate enough to still use my keys.

But once I started tinkering around with it, and after getting some Worlds tokens that I wanted to use, I noticed the fix was actually very simple; for some reason, and I'm not sure if this was caused by a recent change or not but, it seems anti-virus programs are specifically blocking the loot client from using the World's tokens and the Starlight tokens, as well as possibly the normal key fragments and hextech chests (as some others have experienced).

Why it does that and why it seems to affect more things for other people, I haven't the slightest idea. My firewall doesn't affect League itself when I'm playing, but I guess for some reason it finds the newer crafting stuff suspicious all of a sudden.

So if you're having this issue, try turning off your firewall if you're having issues with hextech loot. Should you still have problems, I can't help you there. You'd have to go through submitting a ticket and all that.

replies.body: Had the same problem, fixed it by going to firewall settings and allowing LoL Kernel and LoL Launcher both to use public and private. By default they were only allowed public.

That'd be a pretty weird fix, but ayyy whatever works in my book. Sounds like that firewall was blocking the client when it tried to pull the data for those tokens from our servers. Remember to turn those firewalls back on afterwards if you do turn them off!
